diagnosis.final_diagnosis: HIV-associated nephropathy (collapsing variant of focal segmental glomerulosclerosis)
differential_diagnosis: Minimal change disease and acute tubular necrosis
Membranous nephropathy and bilateral renal-vein thrombosis
Minimal change disease and acute interstitial nephritis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with nephrotic syndrome, acute kidney injury, and nephromegaly. HIV infection was suspected due to risk factors and mononucleosis-like symptoms. Renal biopsy revealed marked tubular injury consistent with collapsing focal segmental glomerulosclerosis associated with HIV. The presence of high proteinuria and the support from histologic findings confirmed the diagnosis.
